fetch_by_month(month, refine='all')¶

Fetches all spectra sampled on a special month (passed as integer). The refine kwarg makes it possible to filter sml and bulk samples

fetch_by_quartal(refine='all', selection='q')¶

Map the BoknisEck spectra to their corresponding quartals of the year. The refine kwarg makes it possible to filter sml and bulk samples

Get all BE samples taken between beginning and end and returns them as a dataframe

Returns a dataframe containing all samples taken in a specified year

Returns a dict of spectra mapped to their month of sampling

get_data_per_sampling_date()¶

Returns a dictionary of BoknisEck spectra objects mapped to their date of sampling. Note that in that stadium they are not plottable SFG objects.

normalize_to_reference_integral(speclist)¶

This function takes a list of BoknisEck spectra, converts them to SfgSpectrum objects and normalizes them to the DPPC integral of ther measurement day. Note that spectra without suitable reference are dropped and are not included in the output

static normalize_year_records(df)¶

Returns a dictionary of dataframes with the BE data and additional normalized to the year’s maximum value columns

add_spectrum(query)¶

This function retrieves via Foreign-Key-relationship the spectral data of the SFG spectrum from the database and constructs the actual SFG object, setting it as attribute of the corresponding boknis_eck object.

SFG.natural_samples.gasex module¶

class SFG.natural_samples.gasex.GasExManager(new=True)¶

Bases: object

The GasExManager classes operates on the data recorded during and in connection with the Baltic GasEx cruise in 2018. If instantiated with new=True, Samples and Stations classes are created from the raw data stored in the database, connected to each other, values calculated and persisted. For everyday-use, the new=False option is recommended. In this case, a Pandas dataframe containing the data of all Stations is generated. This is suitable for plotting and data analysis.

calculate_sample_values()¶

Convenience function to call the stations (and, therefore, samples) functions and collect the average data from the raw single measurements.

static correct_salinity(salinity)¶

A function yielding a salinity-dependent correction factor for the surface tension. The reference salinity where the factor equals zero is 17 PSU.

generate_station_table()¶

Generates a pandas dataframe from the joint columns of stations and station_stats table.

get_stations()¶
persist_stations()¶

Invokes the persist_stat function of each station, ensuring that the calculated values are written to the station_stats table in the database.

class SFG.natural_samples.gasex.Sample(data)¶

Bases: object

The sample class unites all measurement data corresponding to a specific sample conveniently. It is used by the Station class to calculate the corresponding values

calc_coverage(dates)¶

Calculates the surface coverage by normalizing the CH integral to the DPPC reference intensity which is provided as a dictionary of dates.

calc_pressure()¶

Calculate the maximum surface pressure for the LT isotherm measurement of the sample.

calc_values(dates)¶

Top level function to call all data-collecting routines. Needs a dictionary of DPPC reference intensities for the corresponding dates.

get_lift_off()¶

Extract the lift-off value from the dataframe and normalize it to the maximum initial area in order to make it comparable.

set_values()¶
class SFG.natural_samples.gasex.Station(data)¶

Bases: object

This class represents a cruise station. It takes care about its samples, calculates average values and makes them available for plotting purposes via its station table (a Pandas dataframe)

static calc_pure_tension(t)¶
static calc_sal_tension(t, s)¶
calc_stat(value, sample_type)¶

A generic function to calculate all necessary station attributes (eg. SML coverage, deep tension..).

get_all_stats()¶

Function to collect the station’s values including standard deviation and number of samples included in the average.
